description: Lenart Kova decides to act: after weeks of mounting unrest and failed reforms, he compiles and encrypts vast BCI logs, Council debate records, and Halden's diary fragments. As rumors circulate, activists and Council operatives both scramble to access the file.

In a coordinated attack, Lenart hijacks city billboards, terminals, and public displays. Screens across Stenograd reveal raw BCI logs and internal Council arguments, exposing direct links between scoring injustices, disappearances, and factional disputes. Citizens see how their fates were set and who decided them.

Shock turns to action: spontaneous gatherings, teach-ins, and debates erupt in streets and squares. Grassroots groups organize to study the disclosures, and murals illustrating the data appear on major buildings. Calls for truth and accountability echo citywide.

Major protests surge across Stenograd. Civic leaders, ordinary residents, and former officials confront Council representatives, demanding resignations and open trials for abuses. Public trust in the BCI system collapses entirely.

In a last attempt to maintain control, fractured Council factions offer limited reforms, but are dismissed. Protesters demand full dissolution of the Council and public accountability. Power visibly shifts to neighborhood assemblies and grassroots organizers.
